Paper-based file backups made easy

docs.title: About the project
docs.text:
AutoPaper makes backing up your files on paper much easier. It is ideal for files like SSH/GPG/... keys and similar. Each file is compressed, divided into chunks and encoded into QR codes ready to be printed.

To restore these backups, you just scan the QR codes into your computer, and AutoPaper takes care of putting their chunks back together, uncompressing them and outputting the original files.

docs.title: --encrypt, -e
docs.text:
Boolean optional value (defaults to False)

Controls whether to encrypt the files before backing them up

docs.title: --encrypt_pwd, -p
docs.text:
String optional value (defaults to \"\")

Sets password for encryption of the backup. If --encrypt is True and --encrypt-pwd is not set, we'll ask for the password interactively.

docs.title: --force_compress, -c
docs.text:
Boolean optional value (defaults to False)

If True, we always compress all files. If False, we check whether files are reasonable to compress before compressing them.

docs.title: Data format (v0)
docs.text: Every QR code generated by AutoPaper contains the following fields, JSON-serialized.

docs.title: format_ver (int)
docs.text: Version of the data format. Increases with every breaking change to this format. Currently at 0

docs.title: filename (string)
docs.text: The original path and filename where the file was stored at the time of the backup.

docs.title: checksum (str)
docs.text: Contains the SHA256 checksum digest of the entire file.

docs.title: content
docs.text: Contains the contents of the file, base85 encoded.

docs.title: compression_algo (Optional[str])
docs.text: Contains information about the algorithm used to compress the file.

docs.title: encrypted (bool)
docs.text: Boolean, defines whether the file was encrypted (should we ask for a decryption password)

docs.title: chunk (Optional[int])
docs.text:
None if the file is not divided into chunks across multiple codes.

If the file is divided into chunks, each chunk is assigned a serial number from 0. This field contains the chunks number.

docs.title: chunks_total (Optional[int])
docs.text:
None if the file is not divided into chunks across multiple codes.

If the file is divided into chunks, contains the serial number of the last chunk of this file.
